verses.text: And when the seventh month was come, and the children of Israel \add were\add* in the cities, the people gathered themselves together as one man to Jerusalem.

Then stood up Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and his brethren the priests, and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and his brethren, and builded the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt offerings thereon, as it is written in the law of Moses the man of God.

And they set the altar upon his bases; for fear \add was\add* upon them because of the people of \add those\add* countries: and they offered burnt offerings thereon unto the \sc Lord\sc*, \add even\add* burnt offerings morning and evening.
They kept also the feast of tabernacles, as it is written, and \add offered\add* the daily burnt offerings by number, according to the custom, as the duty of every day required;

and afterward \add offered\add* the continual burnt offering, both of the new moons, and of all the set feasts of the \sc Lord\sc* that were consecrated, and of every one that willingly offered a freewill offering unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
From the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt offerings unto the \sc Lord\sc*. But the foundation of the temple of the \sc Lord\sc* was not \add yet\add* laid.

They gave money also unto the masons, and to the carpenters; and meat, and drink, and oil, unto them of Zidon, and to them of Tyre, to bring cedar trees from Lebanon to the sea of Joppa, according to the grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia.

Now in the second year of their coming unto the house of God at Jerusalem, in the second month, began Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and the remnant of their brethren the priests and the Levites, and all they that were come out of the captivity \add unto\add* Jerusalem; and appointed the Levites from twenty years old and upward, to set forward the work of the house of the \sc Lord\sc*.

Then stood Jeshua \add with\add* his sons and his brethren, Kadmiel and his sons, the sons of Judah, together, to set forward the workmen in the house of God: the sons of Henadad, \add with\add* their sons and their brethren the Levites.

And when the builders laid the foundation of the temple of the \sc Lord\sc*, they set the priests in their apparel with trumpets, and the Levites the sons of Asaph with cymbals, to praise the \sc Lord\sc*, after the ordinance of David king of Israel.

And they sung together by course in praising and giving thanks unto the \sc Lord\sc*; because \add he is\add* good, for his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever towards Israel. And all the people shouted \add with\add* a great shout, when they praised the \sc Lord\sc*, because the foundation of the house of the \sc Lord\sc* was laid.

But many of the priests and Levites and chief of the fathers, \add who were\add* ancient men that had seen the first house, when the foundation of this house was laid before their eyes, wept with a loud voice; and many shouted aloud for joy:
so that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people: for the people shouted \add with\add* a loud shout, and the noise was heard afar off.
